title: Ultra-conservative José Antonio Kast elected Chile’s next president | Chile | The Guardian
snippet: The US secretary of state, Marco Rubio, on Sunday congratulated Kast, whose victory has added another right wing leader more closely aligned with Donald Trump in Latin America. Under Kast’s leadership, “we are confident Chile will advance shared priorities to include strengthening public security, ending illegal immigration, and revitalising our commercial relationship,” Rubio said in a statement.

title: President of Chile - Wikipedia
snippet: José Antonio Kast will take office on 11 March 2026, having won the 2025 Chilean general election. The origins of Chile as a nation can be traced to 1541, when it was separated from the existing Viceroyalty of Peru by King Charles I, creating ...

title: 2025 Chilean general election - Wikipedia
snippet: No candidate obtained the required majority to win the presidency outright. As a result, the election proceeded to a runoff between Jeannette Jara and José Antonio Kast on 14 December 2025.
